meanings.definition: To take up and practice or use
meanings.sent1: She decided to adopt a healthier lifestyle by eating more fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: Many people adopt new technologies to make their lives easier.
meanings.sent3: The idea of adopting a daily exercise routine seemed like a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: He adopted a positive attitude towards the difficult task ahead.
meanings.sent5: The company decided to adopt a new policy to improve employee satisfaction.

meanings.definition: To take into one's family through legal means
meanings.sent1: The couple wanted to adopt a child to expand their family.
meanings.sent2: They went through a long process to adopt a baby from another country.
meanings.sent3: The family was overjoyed to finally adopt a little girl after years of waiting.
meanings.sent4: The decision to adopt a child brought immense happiness to their home.
meanings.sent5: They were thrilled to adopt a newborn and provide a loving home.

meanings.definition: To choose or take as one's own
meanings.sent1: She decided to adopt a new approach to solving the problem.
meanings.sent2: The team agreed to adopt his suggestion as the best course of action.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would adopt the idea of having pizza for breakfast every day.
meanings.sent4: She decided to adopt a more positive mindset towards challenges.
meanings.sent5: The company chose to adopt a new logo to represent their brand better.
